00020 //! This is an atomic variant of \a boost::scoped_ptr<>.
00021 //! atomic_scoped_ptr<> can be shared among threads by the use of \a swap(_shared_target_).
00022 //! Namely, a destructive read. Use atomic_shared_ptr<> for non-destructive reading.\n
00023 //! The implementation relies on an atomic-swap machine code, e.g. lock xchg.
00024 //! \sa atomic_shared_ptr
00025 template <typename T>
00026 class atomic_scoped_ptr
00027 {
00028     typedef T* t_ptr;
00029 public:
00030     atomic_scoped_ptr() : m_ptr(0) {
00031     }
00032 
00033     explicit atomic_scoped_ptr(t_ptr t) : m_ptr(t) {
00034         writeBarrier();
00035     }
00036 
00037     ~atomic_scoped_ptr() { readBarrier(); delete m_ptr;}
00038 
00039     void reset(t_ptr t = 0) {
00040         writeBarrier();
00041         t_ptr old = atomicSwap(t, &m_ptr);
00042         readBarrier();
00043         delete old;
00044     }
00045     //! \param x \p x is atomically swapped.
00046     //! Nevertheless, this object is not atomically replaced.
00047     //! That is, the object pointed by "this" must not be shared among threads.
00048     void swap(atomic_scoped_ptr &x) {
00049         writeBarrier();
00050         m_ptr = atomicSwap(m_ptr, &x.m_ptr);
00051         readBarrier();
00052     }
00053 
00054     //! These functions must be called while writing is blocked.
00055     T &operator*() const { ASSERT(m_ptr); return (T&)*m_ptr;}
00056 
00057     t_ptr operator->() const { ASSERT(m_ptr); return (t_ptr)m_ptr;}
00058 
00059     t_ptr get() const {
00060         return (t_ptr )m_ptr;
00061     }
00062 private:
00063     atomic_scoped_ptr(const atomic_scoped_ptr &) {}
00064     atomic_scoped_ptr& operator=(const atomic_scoped_ptr &) {return *this;}
00065 
00066     t_ptr m_ptr;
00067 };
00068 
00069 #define ATOMIC_SHARED_REF_ALIGNMENT 8
00070 
00071 //! This is an internal class holding a global reference counter and a pointer to the object.
00072 //! \sa atomic_shared_ptr
00073 template <typename T>
00074 struct _atomic_shared_ptr_gref {
00075     template <class Y>
00076     _atomic_shared_ptr_gref(Y *p) : ptr(p), refcnt(1) {}
00077     ~_atomic_shared_ptr_gref() { ASSERT(refcnt == 0); delete ptr; }
00078     //! The pointer to the object.
00079     T *ptr;
00080     typedef uintptr_t Refcnt;
00081     //! Global reference counter.
00082     Refcnt refcnt;
00083 } __attribute__((aligned(ATOMIC_SHARED_REF_ALIGNMENT)));;
00084 
00085 
00086 /*! This is an atomic variant of \a boost::shared_ptr<>.\n
00087 * \a atomic_shared_ptr<> can be shared among threads by the use of \a operator=(_target_), \a swap(_target_).
00088 * An instance of \a atomic_shared_ptr<T> holds:\n
00089 *   a) a pointer to \a _atomic_shared_ptr_gref<T>, which is a struct consisting of a pointer to the T-type object, and a global reference counter.\n
00090 *   b) a local (temporary) reference counter, which is embedded in the above pointer by using the least significant bits that should be usually zero.\n
00091 * The values of a) and b), \a m_ref, are atomically handled with CAS machine codes.
00092 * The purpose of b) the local reference counter is to tell the "observation" to the shared target before increasing the global reference counter.
00093 * This process is implemented in \a _reserve_scan_().\n
00094 * A function \a _leave_scan_() tries to decrease the local counter first. When it fails, the global counter is decreased.\n
00095 * To swap the pointer and local reference counter (which will be reset to zero), the setter must adds the local counting to the global counter before swapping.
00096 * \sa atomic_scoped_ptr
00097  */
00098 template <typename T>
00099 class atomic_shared_ptr
00100 {
00101 public:
00102     typedef _atomic_shared_ptr_gref<T> Ref;
00103 
00104     atomic_shared_ptr() {
00105         m_ref = 0;
00106         writeBarrier();
00107     }
00108 
00109     template<typename Y> explicit atomic_shared_ptr(Y *y) {
00110         m_ref = (_RefLocal)new Ref(y);
00111         writeBarrier();
00112     }
00113 
00114     atomic_shared_ptr(const atomic_shared_ptr &t) {
00115         m_ref = (_RefLocal)t._scan_();
00116         writeBarrier();
00117     }
00118     template<typename Y> atomic_shared_ptr(const atomic_shared_ptr<Y> &y) {
00119         m_ref = (_RefLocal)(typename atomic_shared_ptr::Ref*)y._scan_();
00120         writeBarrier();
00121     }
00122 
00123     ~atomic_shared_ptr();
00124 
00125     //! \param t This instance is atomically replaced with \a t.
00126     atomic_shared_ptr &operator=(const atomic_shared_ptr &t) {
00127         atomic_shared_ptr(t).swap(*this);
00128         return *this;
00129     }
00130     //! \param y This instance is atomically replaced with \a t.
00131     template<typename Y> atomic_shared_ptr &operator=(const atomic_shared_ptr<Y> &y) {
00132         atomic_shared_ptr(y).swap(*this);
00133         return *this;
00134     }
00135     //! This instance is atomically reset to null pointer.
00136     void reset() {
00137         atomic_shared_ptr().swap(*this);
00138     }
00139     //! \param y This instance is atomically reset with a pointer \a y.
00140     template<typename Y> void reset(Y *y) {
00141         atomic_shared_ptr(y).swap(*this);
00142     }
00143 
00144     //! \param x \p x is atomically swapped with this instance.
00145     //! Nevertheless, this instance is not atomically replaced.
00146     //! That is, "this" must not be shared among threads.
00147     void swap(atomic_shared_ptr &x);
00148 
00149     //! \return true if succeeded.
00150     //! \sa swap()
00151     bool compareAndSwap(const atomic_shared_ptr &oldvalue, atomic_shared_ptr &target);
00152 
00153     //! The return value is apparently not valid for a shared instance.
00154     T *get() const { Ref *pref = _pref(); return pref ? pref->ptr : 0L; }
00155 
00156     //! The return value is apparently not valid for a shared instance.
00157     T &operator*() const { ASSERT(*this); return *get();}
00158 
00159     //! The return value is apparently not valid for a shared instance.
00160     T *operator->() const { ASSERT(*this); return get();}
00161 
00162     //! The return value is apparently not valid for a shared instance.
00163     bool operator!() const {return !m_ref;}
00164     //! The return value is apparently not valid for a shared instance.
00165     operator bool() const {return m_ref;}
00166 
00167 public:
00168     typedef uintptr_t Refcnt;
00169     //internal functions below.
00170     //! atomically scans \a m_ref and increases the global reference counter.
00171     //! \a _scan_ is used for atomically coping the pointer.
00172     Ref *_scan_() const;
00173     //! atomically scans \a m_ref and increases the  local (temporary) reference counter.
00174     //! use \a _leave_scan_ to release the temporary reference.
00175     Ref *_reserve_scan_(Refcnt *) const;
00176     //! tries to decrease local (temporary) reference counter.
00177     //! In case the reference is lost, \a _leave_scan_ releases the global reference counter instead.
00178     void _leave_scan_(Ref *) const;
00179 private:
00180     typedef uintptr_t _RefLocal;
00181     mutable _RefLocal m_ref;
00182     //! A pointer to global reference struct.
00183     Ref* _pref() const {return (Ref*)(m_ref & (~(uintptr_t)(ATOMIC_SHARED_REF_ALIGNMENT - 1)));}
00184     //! Local (temporary) reference counter.
00185     //! Local reference counter is a trick to tell the observation to other threads.
00186     Refcnt _refcnt() const {return (Refcnt)(m_ref & (uintptr_t)(ATOMIC_SHARED_REF_ALIGNMENT - 1));}
00187 };
00188 
00189 template <typename T>
00190 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::~atomic_shared_ptr() {
00191     readBarrier();
00192     ASSERT(_refcnt() == 0);
00193     Ref *pref = _pref();
00194     if(!pref) return;
00195     // decreasing global reference counter.
00196     readBarrier();
00197     if(atomicDecAndTest(&pref->refcnt)) {
00198         delete pref;
00199     }
00200 }
00201 template <typename T>
00202 typename atomic_shared_ptr<T>::Ref *
00203 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::_reserve_scan_(Refcnt *rcnt) const {
00204     Ref *pref;
00205     Refcnt rcnt_new;
00206     for(;;) {
00207         pref = _pref();
00208         Refcnt rcnt_old;
00209         rcnt_old = _refcnt();
00210         if(!pref) {
00211             // target is null.
00212             *rcnt = rcnt_old;
00213             return 0;
00214         }
00215         rcnt_new = rcnt_old + 1u;
00216         /*
00217         static int rcnt_max = 0;
00218         if(rcnt_new > (int)rcnt_max) {
00219             rcnt_max = rcnt_new;
00220             fprintf(stderr, "max_rcnt=%d\n", rcnt_max);
00221         }
00222         */
00223         if(rcnt_new >= ATOMIC_SHARED_REF_ALIGNMENT) {
00224             // This would be never happen.
00225             usleep(1);
00226             continue;
00227         }
00228         // trying to increase local reference counter w/ same serial.
00229         if(atomicCompareAndSet(
00230             _RefLocal((uintptr_t)pref + rcnt_old),
00231             _RefLocal((uintptr_t)pref + rcnt_new),
00232             &m_ref))
00233             break;
00234     }
00235     ASSERT(rcnt_new);
00236     *rcnt = rcnt_new;
00237     return pref;
00238 }
00239 template <typename T>
00240 typename atomic_shared_ptr<T>::Ref *atomic_shared_ptr<T>::_scan_() const {
00241     Refcnt rcnt;
00242     Ref *pref = _reserve_scan_(&rcnt);
00243     if(!pref) return 0;
00244     atomicInc(&pref->refcnt);
00245     writeBarrier();
00246     _leave_scan_(pref);
00247     return pref;
00248 }
00249 
00250 template <typename T>
00251 void
00252 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::_leave_scan_(Ref *pref) const {
00253     for(;;) {
00254         Refcnt rcnt_old;
00255         rcnt_old = _refcnt();
00256         if(rcnt_old) {
00257             Refcnt rcnt_new = rcnt_old - 1;
00258             // trying to dec. reference counter if stored pointer is unchanged.
00259             if(atomicCompareAndSet(
00260                 _RefLocal((uintptr_t)pref + rcnt_old),
00261                 _RefLocal((uintptr_t)pref + rcnt_new),
00262                 &m_ref))
00263                 break;
00264             if((pref == _pref()))
00265                 continue; // try again.
00266         }
00267         // local reference has released by other processes.
00268         readBarrier();
00269         if(atomicDecAndTest(&pref->refcnt)) {
00270             delete pref;
00271         }
00272         break;
00273     }
00274 }
00275 
00276 template <typename T>
00277 void
00278 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::swap(atomic_shared_ptr<T> &r) {
00279     Ref *pref;
00280     ASSERT(_refcnt() == 0);
00281     for(;;) {
00282         Refcnt rcnt_old, rcnt_new;
00283         pref = r._reserve_scan_(&rcnt_old);
00284         if(pref) {
00285             atomicAdd(&pref->refcnt, rcnt_old - 1u);
00286             writeBarrier();
00287         }
00288         rcnt_new = 0;
00289         if(atomicCompareAndSet(
00290             _RefLocal((uintptr_t)pref + rcnt_old),
00291             _RefLocal((uintptr_t)_pref() + rcnt_new),
00292             &r.m_ref))
00293             break;
00294         if(pref) {
00295             ASSERT(rcnt_old);
00296             atomicAdd(&pref->refcnt, (Refcnt)( -(int)(rcnt_old - 1u)));
00297             r._leave_scan_(pref);
00298         }
00299     }
00300     m_ref = (_RefLocal)pref;
00301 }
00302 
00303 template <typename T>
00304 bool
00305 atomic_shared_ptr<T>::compareAndSwap(const atomic_shared_ptr<T> &oldr, atomic_shared_ptr<T> &r) {
00306     Ref *pref;
00307     ASSERT(_refcnt() == 0);
00308     for(;;) {
00309         Refcnt rcnt_old, rcnt_new;
00310         pref = r._reserve_scan_(&rcnt_old);
00311         if(pref != oldr._pref()) {
00312             if(pref)
00313                 r._leave_scan_(pref);
00314             return false;
00315         }
00316         if(pref) {
00317             atomicAdd(&pref->refcnt, rcnt_old - 1u);
00318             writeBarrier();
00319         }
00320         rcnt_new = 0;
00321         if(atomicCompareAndSet(
00322             _RefLocal((uintptr_t)pref + rcnt_old),
00323             _RefLocal((uintptr_t)_pref() + rcnt_new),
00324             &r.m_ref))
00325             break;
00326         if(pref) {
00327             ASSERT(rcnt_old);
00328             atomicAdd(&pref->refcnt, (Refcnt)( -(int)(rcnt_old - 1u)));
00329             r._leave_scan_(pref);
00330         }
00331     }
00332     m_ref = (_RefLocal)pref;
00333     return true;
00334 }
00335 
00336 template <typename T, class Enable>
00337 class atomic
00338 {
00339 public:
00340     atomic() : m_var(new T) {}
00341     atomic(T t) : m_var(new T(t)) {}
00342     atomic(const atomic &t) : m_var(t) {}
00343     ~atomic() {}
00344     operator T() const {
00345         atomic_shared_ptr<T> x = m_var;
00346         return *x;
00347     }
00348     atomic &operator=(T t) {
00349         m_var.reset(new T(t));
00350         return *this;
00351     }
00352     T swap(T newv) {
00353         atomic_shared_ptr<T> x(newv);
00354         x.swap(m_var);
00355         return *x;
00356     }
00357 protected:
00358     atomic_shared_ptr<T> m_var;
00359 };
